info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 15 at 10:52PM PDT until August 15 at 11:45PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN CLARK COUNTY... At 1052 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated another round of thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the far northwest portion of the Las Vegas Valley, Spring Mountains and Red Rock Canyon. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen over the warned area and an additional 0.25 to 0.50 inches of rain can be expected by 1115 PM PDT. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kyle Canyon Road, Centennial Hills, Lone Mountain, Red Rock Canyon, Spring Mountains. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
